title: Pats' Diggs faces strangulation, assault charges
content: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs is facing a felony charge of strangulation and a misdemeanor charge of assault from alleged Dec. 2 incident.

title: Cowboys release two-time Pro Bowl CB Diggs
content: The Cowboys have released cornerback Trevon Diggs. He will become a free agent if he goes unclaimed on waivers.

title: NCAA clarifies eligibility stance amid criticism
content: President Charlie Baker clarified the NCAA's position on college eligibility for players with NBA experience Tuesday, saying "it has not and will not grant eligibility to any prospective or returning student-athletes who have signed an NBA contract."

title: CMC misses Tue. practice ahead of Seahawks tilt
content: Niners star Christian McCaffrey missed Tuesday's practice with a stiff back, while left tackle Trent Williams nursed a right hamstring injury ahead of Saturday's showdown with the Seahawks.

title: Williams nixes portal talk, declares Bama return
content: Alabama wide receiver Ryan Williams intends to return to the team in 2026 despite a bumpy sophomore season.

title: Emery denies Arteta snub after Arsenal beat Villa
content: Unai Emery rejected claims that he snubbed Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta after the full-time whistle in Aston Villa's clash at the Emirates Stadium.

content: Duke moved atop the 2026 recruiting class rankings after Deron Rippey Jr., the No. 3-ranked point guard in the country, became the Blue Devils' third five-star commitment.

content: Texas Tech quarterback Behren Morton is out of a walking boot and close to 100% healthy after playing through a hairline fracture for much of the season.

title: Not Yashasvi or Siraj: These four Indians feature in CA's Test XI of 2025; see full list
content: As the year draws to a close, a number of players delivered notable performances in Test cricket. Based on those displays, Cricket Australia announced its Test XI of the year for 2025.

title: Ban on Starlink: China says Musk's SpaceX national security threat; What China fears
content: Chinese authorities have penalized a foreign vessel for illegally using Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite internet service, within its waters. Banned in China due to national security concerns and lack of operating licenses, Starlink's overseas gateway routing is seen as a threat to strategic interests. China aims to counter this perceived monopoly by developing its own reusable rocket technology.

title: Couple's greed for property turned UP home into 5-year prison; gory details emerge
content: A 70-year-old man and his mentally challenged daughter were allegedly held captive and starved for five years by their domestic help in UP's Mahoba district. The case surfaced after the man's death, revealing his emaciated state and his daughter's skeletal condition. Relatives allege the couple sought to seize the family's property.

title: No more subsidy for electric three-wheelers: Govt meets target; ends relief
content: The Centre has ended subsidies for electric three-wheelers after exceeding its penetration target. Support for electric two-wheelers may extend into the next fiscal year as sales are still below the goal. States are now expected to provide incentives, with Delhi poised to announce a package to boost EV adoption.

title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's son Raihan gets engaged to long-time girlfriend Aviva Baig; family in Rajasthan
content: Raihan Vadra, son of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Robert Vadra, has become engaged to his long-time friend Aviva Baig. The private ceremony was attended by close family and friends, with both families having known each other for years. The couple's families are currently celebrating the occasion in Ranthambore, Rajasthan.

title: Chinese billionaire‚Äôs plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 kids; wants US-borns to run video game biz
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection day 26: Ranveer Singh starrer to soar past Rs 1,100 crore mark
content: Aditya Dhar's spy-thriller 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, is dominating the box office, nearing Rs 712.25 crore in domestic net collections after 26 days. The film has achieved the biggest Bollywood grosser status with Rs 854.75 crore gross and a staggering Rs 1095.5 crore worldwide. It's now challenging 'Jawan's' record.

title: 'Suryakumar used to message me': Reality TV actor claims; who is Khushi Mukherjee?
content: Speaking at a recent event, Khushi said that Suryakumar used to message her often earlier, but they are no longer in touch. When asked by a reporter if she wanted to date a cricketer, Khushi said she does not want to be linked with any player.

title: 'I‚Äôll urinate in your mouth': Woman SI threatens couple; shunted
content: A UP Police sub-inspector, SI Ratna Rathi, was caught on video verbally abusing and threatening a young couple during a traffic jam in Meerut. The officer, reportedly frustrated by the delay, made highly offensive remarks. The incident, recorded by bystanders, has led to an investigation and her attachment to police lines in Aligarh.

title: 2025: Google made up for its '2024 AI mistake'; error made CEO Pichai say 'unacceptable'
content: Google's AI comeback, spearheaded by Gemini 3, has shaken OpenAI, forcing CEO Sam Altman to issue a 'code red'.  Following earlier stumbles, a dream team including Demis Hassabis and Sergey Brin revitalized the company.  Gemini's user base surged, surpassing ChatGPT in app store rankings and challenging OpenAI's enterprise dominance, marking a significant shift in the AI landscape.

title: Proof, not promises: New food products to get strict checks; FSSAI makes evidence mandatory
content: India's food regulator, FSSAI, will now mandate scientific evidence for all food safety reviews and standard changes from January 1, 2026. Submissions must detail nutritional information, consumption patterns, toxicological studies, and allergy risks specific to Indian consumers. This move aims to ensure practical, science-based, and safer food regulations for the public.

title: ‚ÄòWe turned off the money spigot‚Äô: Trump admin freezes Minnesota child care funds. But why?
content: The US Department of Health and Human Services has halted all child care payments to Minnesota, citing widespread fraud. Millions in taxpayer funds are alleged to have been diverted to fake daycares. A new system now requires justification and evidence for all payments nationwide. An investigation into a learning center receiving $4 million with no activity has surfaced.

title: All is well: Sacked Himachal doctor, patient 'patch up' with a hug; assault row ends
content: A doctor and patient involved in a Shimla assault case publicly reconciled, shaking hands and embracing after apologizing for their scuffle. The incident, which led to a statewide doctors' strike, was resolved through dialogue, with both parties expressing regret for the disruption caused.

title: Stefon Diggs scans stands for Cardi B after Patriots‚Äô 42-10 win over Jets
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs searched for his partner Cardi B after a decisive win against the New York Jets. This public display of affection garnered varied reactions online. Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: Candace Owens flags new claims questioning Charlie Kirk death timeline
content: Candace Owens says Mitch Snow‚Äôs claims about Charlie Kirk‚Äôs death need verified timelines, not assumptions. Snow, a retired Army medic, says he was at Fort Huachuca and saw key figures. Online users question his memory and details. No official proof confirms his account. Owens asks for solid evidence to settle the debate.

title: Stephen Curry‚Äôs son Canon Curry stuns fans with elite dribbling skills
content: Stephen Curry's son, Canon, showcased remarkable dribbling skills during a Warriors game. The view captivated fans and the clip went viral. Comparisons to 'The Lion King's' Simba emerged, with many predicting a bright future for the young prodigy.  Canon, the youngest of Stephen and Ayesha Curry's four children, is already impressing with his talent.

title: JFK granddaughter passes away: Tatiana Schlossberg dies at 35 due to cancer; who was she?
content: Tatiana Schlossberg, President John F. Kennedy's youngest granddaughter, has passed away at 35 after a battle with a rare form of leukemia. Diagnosed shortly after the birth of her second child, she bravely underwent extensive treatments. A Yale and Oxford graduate, Schlossberg was a published author and former journalist, leaving behind her husband and two young children.

title: Nick Shirley targets Tim Walz as Minnesota childcare page goes offline amid fraud claim
content: Nick Shirley claims Minnesota‚Äôs childcare system is under pressure after the state‚Äôs licensing page went down. Lawmakers questioned Governor Tim Walz as officials visited daycare centers named in Shirley‚Äôs videos. Walz‚Äôs office denied wrongdoing and ordered audits. State leaders say concerns are being taken seriously, but investigations are still ongoing.

title: Bengal SIR: Ailing poet Joy Goswami among 'unmapped' voters; get Jan 2 hearing call
content: Sahitya Akademi awardee Joy Goswami, a 72-year-old poet, is among Bengal's unmapped voters, summoned for a hearing by the EC. His daughter alleges "pervasive politics of fear" and systemic harassment, questioning the motive behind targeting voters, especially in Bengal, and fears her father, recuperating from surgeries, will be disenfranchised.

title: Gruesome murder: Robbers kill wife of Punjab's former top govt lawyer; help detained
content: A shocking incident in Mohali saw Ashok Kumari Goyal, wife of a former Additional Advocate General, found strangled in her home. The family's servant was discovered tied up, with police suspecting a robbery gone awry. Valuables and cash are reported missing, and the accused are still at large. The servant's account has raised suspicions, leading to his detention for questioning.

title: 'Home I dug for myself': Telangana man builds his 'final resting place'; tends to it daily
content: An 80-year-old man in Telangana has personally dug and constructed his own granite grave, costing Rs 12 lakh. He meticulously maintains the site daily, finding peace in preparing for his inevitable end. This proactive approach stems from a life marked by early loss and a desire to avoid burdening his children.

title: Drill, dash, disappear: Robbers crack German bank vault; vanish with $35 million
content: Robbers drilled into a bank vault in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, making off with approximately $35 million in cash, gold, and jewelry. The suspects successfully breached over 3,000 safe deposit boxes before escaping. Authorities are currently investigating the incident, and the perpetrators remain at large.

title: Magic Johnson vs Shaq net worth 2025: NBA earnings, deals and endorsements
content: Magic Johnson's net worth is estimated at $1.5 billion in 2025, with $40 million earned from his NBA career and significant wealth generated through business ventures and endorsements. Shaquille O'Neal's net worth is reported at $500 million in 2025, having earned between $286-$296 million from his 19-season NBA career and various brand partnerships.

title: Defining moment: India now 4th largest economy; when will it overtake Germany?
content: India has emerged as the world‚Äôs fourth-largest economy, overtaking Japan, and is projected to challenge Germany for the third spot within the next three years. The government remains confident about sustaining growth momentum despite global trade uncertainties.

title: World rapid & blitz: History for India! Erigaisi becomes first since Anand to podium
content: Arjun Erigaisi delivered a memorable performance at the World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2025, winning bronze medals in both events. He became the first Indian since Viswanathan Anand to get podium finishes at both the championships. Despite semifinal losses to Nodirbek Abdusattorov, Arjun‚Äôs strong showing in Doha highlighted his growing stature in world chess.

title: Amid horrific BBL stint, PCB calls back star Pak cricketer; here's why
content: Afridi suffered a knee cartilage injury while fielding during Brisbane Heat‚Äôs last-over win against Adelaide Strikers at the Gabba on Saturday night.

title: Court relief: CBI drops attempt-to-murder charge; eight J&K cops granted bail
content: Eight policemen, including a DSP, accused of illegally holding and torturing a J&K constable for six days in February 2023 have been granted bail by a Kupwara court. This follows the CBI dropping attempt-to-murder charges against the accused after a Supreme Court-directed investigation into the alleged abuse.

title: Watch: Vande Bharat clocks 180kmph; passes 'water test'
content: Vande Bharat sleeper train has touched the 180 kmph speed mark during speed trials by the Commissioner Railway Safety. The new train set is a sleeper variant of the popular Vande Bharat chair car service and is set to be launched soon.

title: Risk at 4.30am: How UP Roadways drivers steer through fog; demand for urgent fixes grows
content: Bus drivers in Noida are navigating thick fog, risking their lives to transport commuters to destinations like Agra. Despite hazardous conditions and the risk of accidents, drivers continue their duty due to contractual pay. The UPSRTC is taking measures like fog lights and speed limits, but inadequate expressway lighting exacerbates the dangers.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
content: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: Sriram Raghavan says he would never make movie like 'Dhurandhar'
content: Filmmaker Sriram Raghavan expressed his admiration for the box office hit 'Dhurandhar' by Aditya Dhar, but firmly stated that he would never venture into a similar filmmaking territory. He appreciates the film's success and compelling performances; however, he feels that its style does not resonate with his artistic vision or the evolving landscape of thriller cinema.

title: 2025: The year America normalised anti-India hate
content: Not to White Castle specifically, but to a sort of ‚Äòwhite castle‚Äô: where you are so integrated and assimilated that you are considered a beacon of society, an upstanding member of the Shining City on the Top of The Hill. A place where your faith was acceptable as all the other faiths that existed in the American tapestry.

title: Retirement that stunned Indian cricket - How Dhoni's Test career ended
content: Without any ceremony, 44 minutes after MS Dhoni finished his post-match press conference following the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the BCCI sent out a press release. The news came an hour after India had managed to draw an away Test ‚Äî the first time in the previous 14 Australia-India Tests that the visiting team had not lost.

title: Keeping a goldfish on your office desk is a cruelty on that fish
content: Desk bowls, often seen as charming additions, are detrimental to goldfish. These active, long-lived animals require significant space, proper filtration, and stable environments.  Confined to small bowls, they suffer stunted growth, weakened immunity, and a drastically shortened lifespan, highlighting the need for responsible pet ownership beyond mere aesthetics.

title: Air India plane crash, Goa fire & more: Why 2025 felt like a year of endless crises
content: 2025 was a year of profound loss, marked by a series of devastating events across India and globally. From deadly stampedes at religious gatherings and railway stations to a catastrophic earthquake in Myanmar and Thailand, the year witnessed widespread tragedy.

title: When a poster row strained Jayalalithaa‚Äôs relationship with sections of Christians
content: The controversy transpired when a functionary of her party, out of his ‚Äúdesperation to demonstrate loyalty‚Äù to the leader, got hoardings and posters put up in the State capital, depicting the Chief Minister as Virgin Mary, on the eve of her birthday in February 1995

content: Cooperative Minister to launch membership-cum-awareness drive at panchayat level from Jan 2, in order to create awareness among people about its schemes and also to carry out a membership drive of PACS.

title: India is now fourth largest economy, says govt.
content: The government says that with the GDP valued at $4.18 trillion, ‚ÄúIndia has surpassed Japan to become the world‚Äôs fourth largest economy‚Äù, it says that the country is ‚Äúpoised to displace Germany from the third rank‚Äù with a projected GDP of $7.3 trillion by 2030

title: Cybercrime cases recorded a decline in NTR District this year
content: Overall crime rate went down by 21.66%, while property offences, crimes against women, POCSO cases, road accidents also recorded a decline

title: A.P. HC directs VMC to shift destitute people to shelter homes
content: MA&UD Department told to file an affidavit on steps that can be taken to ensure that destitute people, both men and women, do not sleep on pavement

title: China ‚Äòmediated‚Äô in Pakistan, India tensions: Wang Yi
content: China's role in the May 7-10 Operation Sindoor conflict between India and Pakistan this year came under serious scrutiny and criticism, especially the military assistance provided by Beijing to Islamabad

content: Cabinet also gives green light for the second revised cost proposal for the oil refinery at Pachpadra

content: Govi.¬†Chezhiaan¬†says there are  options available and the final decision will soon be taken by the Chief Minister. The Governor reserved the Bill for the President‚Äôs consideration, stating that it would go against the¬†UGC¬† regulations and established norms. ‚ÄúThis shows the partisan behaviour on the part of the Governor, proving that he is not fit to hold the post,‚Äù he says

title: 10 arrested for distributing swords in Ghaziabad after video goes viral
content: Opposition parties in the State alleged that the incident is part of a pattern aimed at disturbing communal harmony in western of Uttar Pradesh.

content: From finding a mention as the wife of Bangladesh President in the diplomatic records of a 1979 banquet to hosting the Indian Prime Minister in SAARC summits, Khaleda Zia kept interacting with the Indian leadership and maintained a working relationship

title: Principal Scientific Advisor‚Äôs white paper says open access to AI infra key in India
content: The report‚Äôs view is consistent with the government‚Äôs own stand that AI systems need to be accessible to a wider range of the public, something that concentration in a few firms and ‚Äúurban centres‚Äù may tilt the technology away from.

content: Platforms and intermediaries will face action if they do not comply with IT Rules that bar display of objectionable content, it says

content: In a letter to Union Labour Minister¬†Mansukh¬†Mandaviya, they urged the Centre‚Äôs immediate intervention to stop ‚Äòexploitation‚Äô of workers by platforms in the food delivery and taxi service sectors

content: CPI meet emphasises need for serious introspection to understand why people had given the Left the short shrift despite the government‚Äôs¬†strong performance¬†on many fronts

title: Five dead, over 1,000 fall ill due to contaminated water from municipal pipeline in Indore
content: According to officials, several residents of the Bhagirathpura area have been admitted to various hospitals since December 24 after complaints of vomiting and diarrhoea

content: ‚ÄúThey [the BJP] claim there are infiltrators only in Bengal and none in Kashmir. Then who carried out Pahalgam attack? You say infiltrators exist only in Bengal, then what happened in Delhi? Who was responsible for the blast?‚Äù she asks

title: VPN barred in four Kashmir districts ‚Äòdue to security¬†reasons‚Äô
content: In the past 24 hours, the four districts of Shopian, Kulgam, Budgam and Srinagar have, in separate orders, suspended the usage of VPNs,¬†which allow Internet users to mask their locations and identity

title: Trump repeats claim of ending India-Pakistan conflict during Netanyahu meeting
content: U.S. President again asserts role in halting hostilities, as India maintains no third-party mediation

title: Did ruling Congress surrender to AICC diktat to cater to party‚Äôs interests in Kerala?
content: Apparently, the Congress-led State government appears to be serving the party‚Äôs interests in Kerala, which is expected to vote for the Assembly in March/April 2026

title: Rare Imperial Eagle spotted in Mudumalai Tiger Reserve
content: The bird breeds primarily throughout Western and Central Asia, while they also migrate during winter to parts of Africa, the Middle East as well as South and East Asia

title: Pawan Kalyan virtually lays foundation for Sankaraguptam drain modernisation in Konaseema
content: ‚Çπ20.77 crore project to ease drainage woes, protect coconut plantations; works begin ahead of schedule, says Deputy Chief Minister

title: Congress accuses the ECI of making arbitrary changes to the process of conducting SIR
content: The ECI was carrying out the SIR process in a hit-and-trial manner as it had not issued any clear instructions to the Booth-Level Officers, nor had they been given any training, Tamil Nadu MP Sasikanth Senthil said

content: The petitioners demanded that the reservation roster be followed in accordance with the Supreme Court guidelines and sought cancellation of the notification issued in 2023

content: Union Minister accuses AAP government of defying Parliament, flags alleged irregularities in MGNREGA implementation

title: Attingal municipal chairperson prioritises infra, waste management projects
content: A major project will be taken up in association with the Kerala Water Authority to  address drinking water scarcity in several areas

title: Kerala govt to launch citizen response programme field study on Jan. 1
content: From January 1, trained volunteers will conduct door-to-door visits across homes to record people‚Äôs responses. Named Nava¬†Keralam¬†Citizen Response¬†Programme¬†Development/ Welfare Study,¬†the initiative is a means for the government to understand the development needs of the people and involve them in the policy-planning process

content: Leaders allege government move to suppress opposition voices over proposed ethanol factories at IFFCO Kisan SEZ in Nellore district

content: The major works under the initiative include expanding the existing terminals with additional platforms, stabling lines, pit lines, and adequate shunting facilities, identifying and creating new terminals in and around urban areas, and setting up maintenance facilities

title: A.P. raises ‚Çπ4,000 crore through open market borrowings
content: The move towards the end of the year has led to the total open market borrowings in the calendar year crossing ‚Çπ86,000 crore

title: Election Commission directs home verification for elderly, disabled persons in Bengal
content: Notices of hearings have already been sent to several elderly persons as well as persons with disabilities in The State.

title: 1,200 police personnel to manage New Year revelry crowds in Fort Kochi
content: New Year celebrations, mainly the burning of Pappanji effigies, will be held this year at Parade Ground and Veli Ground

title: Swift response averts higher toll in Tatanagar‚ÄìErnakulam Express fire
content: Officials credit inter-departmental coordination for saving lives, while trade unions flag safety risks from untrained outsourced staff

title: Curriculum and textbook revision for Classes I to XII in Kerala nearing completion
content: All academic changes introduced will strictly follow the Kerala Curriculum Framework formulated independently by the State, says General Education Minister V. Sivankutty. Kerala will academically resist all attempts by the Centre to  force the NEP and unilaterally  impose curriculum changes, he says

title: BLAs can submit up to 10 claims and objections forms to BLOs daily: EC
content: Chief Electoral Officer Archana Patnaik says BLAs have to submit the forms along with an undertaking that the applications had been personally verified and that the particulars furnished were correct

title: Russia Says Ukraine Targets Moscow With Drones
content: Ukraine launched a series of drone attacks on Tuesday targeting Moscow, parts of western Russia and annexed Crimea, injuring one person near the Russian capital, Russian authorities said.

title: Journalist Tatiana Schlossberg, Granddaughter Of John F Kennedy, Dies At 35
content: American environmental journalist Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of late president John F. Kennedy, has died from cancer at the age of 35, her family announced Tuesday.

title: India Imposes Tariff On Steel Products For 3 Years To Curb Cheap Imports
content: India has imposed a three-year import tariff of between 11% and 12% on some steel products, according to a finance ministry order published on Tuesday, as the government aims to curb cheap shipments from China.

title: Elon Musk's xAI Buys Third Building To Expand AI Compute Power
content: Elon Musk said on Tuesday his artificial intelligence startup xAI has bought a third building to expand its infrastructure, aiming to boost training capacity to nearly 2 gigawatts of compute power.

title: 35-Year-Old Man Arrested For Raping Minor Stepdaughter In UP: Cops
content: A 35-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 13-year-old stepdaughter, police said on Tuesday.

title: Students Across Iran Stage Protest As Economic Crisis Deepens
content: Iranian students staged street protests in Tehran on Tuesday, a day after the capital's shopkeepers demonstrated against economic hardship and won a message of understanding from the president.

title: Two Trains Collide In Uttarakhand's Chamoli, 60 Injured
content: About 60 people were injured a loco train carrying workers and officials collided with a goods train inside Pipalkoti tunnel of the Vishnugad-Pipalkoti Hydro Electric Project tunnel in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district late Tuesday evening, officials sa

title: Not Racism, But Will Probe That Too: Dehradun Cop On Tripura Student's Death
content: The killing of Anjel Chakma, the student from Tripura in Uttarakhand's Dehradun, was probably not a racial attack, the police say, but they also point out that they are exploring all angles including racism.

title: SEBI Cancels Registration Of 'Research Analyst' Found Running Grocery Shop
content: In a shocking case that surprised even the regulator, the Securities and Exchange Board of India has cancelled the registration of a person who was officially listed as a research analyst but was actually running a small grocery shop in Madurai.

title: Properties Worth Over Rs 100 crore Attached In Chhattisgarh Liquor Scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate alleged that a "criminal" syndicate, involving senior bureaucrats and political figures of the state, "completely hijacked" the Chhattisgarh excise department between 2019 and 2023.

title: Focus Will Shift From Hype To Real-World Use For AI In 2026: Satya Nadella
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has said that 2026 will be a crucial year for artificial intelligence, marking a shift from experimentation and excitement to wider, real-world adoption of the technology.

title: Gurugram Man Loses Rs 2 Crore After Friend Fakes Sister's Cancer Treatment
content: A man from Gurugram was duped of Rs 2.18 crore by a friend who allegedly claimed that she needed it for her sister's cancer treatment.

title: 10,000 People Displaced By Violence In Manipur Resettled: Chief Secretary
content: Manipur Chief Secretary Puneet Kumar Goel on Tuesday said that nearly 10,000 people, who have been displaced because of the ethnic violence in the state since May 2023, have been resettled.

title: 3 Men Throw Chilli Powder In Madhya Pradesh Farmer's Eyes, Snatch Rs 25 Lakh
content: Three assailants on Tuesday robbed a farmer of Rs 25 lakh after throwing chilli powder in his eyes and snatching his bag in Ashoknagar district of Madhya Pradesh, police said.

title: Former Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia To Be Buried Beside Her Husband's Grave
content: The funeral of Bangladesh's former prime minister Khaleda Zia will be held on Wednesday and she will be buried with full state honours beside her husband, late president Ziaur Rahman, the interim government said on Tuesday.

title: IndiGo Faces Rs 458 Crore GST Penalty, Airline Set To Contest Ruling
content: The country's largest airline IndiGo on Tuesday said authorities have slapped a GST penalty of over Rs 458 crore, and that it would contest the decision.

title: Mumbai Airport Commissions New Taxiway To Boost Flight Departure Capacity
content: Mumbai International Airport on Tuesday announced the commissioning of a new taxiway at its facility, aimed at significantly improving the flight departure capacity during peak periods.

title: Ocean's Eleven-Style Heist In German Bank, Robbers Vanish With $35 Million
content: Robbers used a large drill to break into a German bank's vault room and steal cash and valuables worth some 30 million euros ($35 million), police said on Tuesday.

title: S Jaishankar To Attend Former Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia's Funeral In Dhaka
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will represent India at the funeral of former Bangladesh prime minister Khaleda Zia in Dhaka on Wednesday.

title: BJP Leaders Inaugurate Atal Library Twice On Same Day In Faridabad
content: Union Minister of State Krishan Pal Gurjar and Haryana minister Vipul Goyal both denied knowledge about the inauguration of the library by the other on Sunday.

title: Free agent pickups: Look to Saints, Titans amid Week 18 uncertainty
content: the 17th and penultimate Sunday of the season featured excellent performances by new England Patriots QB Drake Maye, Cincinnati Bengals RB Chase Brown and New Orleans Saints WR Chris Olave . the Patriots and Seattle Seahawks each won their 13th game; the Las Vegas Raiders lost their 14th game .

title: Premier League summer transfer overperformers: Madueke, Xhaka lead the way
content: the 2025-26 premier league season reaches the halfway stage with Gameweek 19 (Dec. 30 and Jan. 1) . some have failed to hit the heights and live up to their preseason billing . there are plenty of premier league players who have caught the eye by producing unexpected levels of consistency and top-level performances .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: OJ Arnold boosts Georgia Southern in rivalry win
content: the 2025 bowl season is in full swing, and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances from bowl season . we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . a mistake-laden game featured the most combined penalties and penalty yards .

title: After emphatic win over title rivals, Arsenal can dare to dream once more
content: Steve Nicol makes arsenal premier league title favorites after emphatic win over Aston Villa . the win was more than just a 4-1 victory . it answers a valid question of their journey to this point: could they actually beat one of their rivals for the title?

title: Our 2025 All-Rookie Team: We picked standout first-years at every single position
content: all rookies make bad plays, and peak performances are weighed fairly heavily . this list is based on the bulk of positive plays . it's the right time to summarize some seasonlong performances . we turn our eyes to the race to super Bowl LX .

title: ACC preview: Final Four contenders, more March Madness predictions
content: the 18-team league received its lowest number of NCAA bids in more than a decade . it hasn't been a top-three conference since before 2020 . the ACC had eight top-40 teams in 2019 compared to last season's four .

title: Our NBA cheat sheet for 2026: Big questions, awards picks and All-NBA rosters
content: there have been scandals (yes, plural ) that have cast a shadow over multiple franchises . there has been one ignominious ending for an all-time great in Chris Paul . we created a cheat sheet to get you caught up on everything that has happened across the NBA over the past few months .

title: J&K: Suspected terrorists sighted; anti-terror ops launched in Kishtwar, Doda and Poonch
content: security forces launched cordon-and-search operations in the upper reaches of Kishtwar, Doda and Poonch districts . two groups of jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists, each consisting of two to three ultras, were believed to be moving in the region . the region has witnessed encounters in the past .

title: J&K: NIA court issues proclamation against 3 absconders; move to curb anti-national propaganda
content: NIA court in Srinagar issued a proclamation against three Kashmiris . investigators have established their alleged role in propagating content deemed prejudicial to the sovereignty and integrity of India . the court directed them to appear before it by Jan 31, 2026 .

title: Historic first: Constitution translated in Kashmiri; panel hails 'watershed moment'
content: scholars had tried to translate the Constitution of India into Kashmiri for decades . the translation is now available on the union law ministry‚Äôs website . Prof. aejaz Mohammad sheikh of university of Kashmir described the work as a ‚Äúwatershed moment‚Äù for Kashmiri language .

title: The good, bad and ugly: Big wins for Falcons, Niners, but what happened to Steelers, others?
content: the Texans beat the Chargers to clinch a third consecutive playoff berth for the first time in franchise history . quarterback Derrick Henry carried the Ravens to victory over the Packers . the Bucs and Panthers both lost to set up a matchup for the NFC Souvenir .

title: Key matchups, players to watch and projections for CFP quarterfinals
content: a rematch of one of the most contentious national title games of the 2000s . a battle between new-ish money (Oregon) and new money (Texas Tech) the quarterfinals of the college football playoff kick off Wednesday evening in Arlington, Texas .

title: 'World-class lethality': India inks deals worth Rs 4,666cr; what Army, Navy will get
content: defence ministry inked contracts worth Rs 4,666 crore for procurement of 4.25 lakh close-quarter battle carbines . the deal was inked with two domestic firms and 48 heavyweight torpedoes . 60% of the carbines will be manufactured by Bharat Forge, the rest by PLR Systems .

title: Bengal SIR deaths: Kin file complaints against CEC, state poll body chief; ECI reacts
content: two elderly voters who died after receiving hearing notices have lodged police complaints against them . their names appear on the 2002 physical SIR rolls but are not reflected on EC's online database due to a technical glitch . the 82-year-old jumped before a moving train hours before scheduled hearing .

title: 'Afraid to leave house alone': UP students speaks out; slams 'vigilantes' who stormed party
content: a 22-year-old nursing student from Badaun says she has not stepped out of her relative's home . she says the assault on her friends has left her questioning whether she must now "choose friends based on religion" five people have been arrested so far, police say .

title: 'For legal emergencies': CJI wants 'approachable' people's courts; lists his priorities
content: if a citizen faces a legal emergency or is threatened with arrest by probe agencies at unearthly hours, the person will be able to seek a hearing from constitutional courts even in the dead of night . the chief justice of india said one of his priorities is to set up as many constitution benches as possible to deal with pending petitions .

title: Border bonds: Jalpaiguri mourns its daughter Khaleda; B'desh ex-PM was born in Bengal town
content: former Bangladesh's first woman PM to embattled mass leader, historian says . "it was a loss of one of their own," zia's father says of her early life in the town . she was sent to Jogmaya Primary School before her family moved to the town in the 1950s . her early education began in the village .

title: 'Was radicalising youths': Assam Police busts terror cell linked to Bangladesh; 11 arrested
content: assam police busted a module of imam Mahmuder Kafila (IMK) with the arrest of 11 alleged operatives of the Bangladesh-based offshoot formed in 2018 . 10 were picked up from Assam and one from Tripura in operations since late Monday night . investigators said IMK expanded its base in the state after Bangladesh's regime change that led to the exit of former prime minister sheikh Hasina .

title: 'Premature': Family of Tripura youth questions U'khand police; dismisses 'no racism' theory
content: the family of anjel Chakma pushed back sharply against the city police chief's dismissal of racial slurs as a motive behind the murder . the family says the police are choosing to ignore the words of the only eyewitness . "how do you expect anyone to stop and film something like that?" he says .
